meanings.definition: A rail or barrier placed along the side of a road or path to prevent vehicles from veering off the edge.
meanings.sent1: The guardrails along the highway kept the cars safe from going off the road.
meanings.sent2: When walking on the mountain trail, hold onto the guardrails for support.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to balance on the guardrails like a tightrope walker.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed against the guardrails of caution as she took a leap of faith.
meanings.sent5: The bright red color of the guardrails made them stand out against the green landscape.

meanings.definition: A metal or wooden railing used for safety or support on stairs or balconies.
meanings.sent1: The guardrails on the staircase prevented accidents by providing a sturdy barrier.
meanings.sent2: Children should always hold onto the guardrails when going up or down the stairs.
meanings.sent3: The guardrails on the balcony doubled as a makeshift drying rack for laundry.
meanings.sent4: His dreams soared higher than the guardrails of reality could contain.
meanings.sent5: The intricate design of the guardrails added elegance to the simple staircase.
